page.title: 16Health
page.content: The residents of all the villages live a healthy life and much health care is prevention. A General Practitioner living in Littlebourne has a surgery on the Hill and has a community nurse to assist him. An antenatal clinic is held monthly and most mothers go to the Kent and Canterbury Hospital for birth and return home to be looked after by the community midwife. A child care clinic is held monthly where checks are made on pre-school children and immunisation against whooping cough, measles, tetanus, polio and diptheria are carried out. A school health service looks after booster immunisation. A well womens clinic is held monthly to check breasts, cervical smears and family planning. The surgery is open daily for consultations and visits are made to people in their own homes.
